snippet: The Tenement Museum on the Lower East receives a visit from the last living resident who remembers the building as it was in the 1930s.
abstract: Eighty-eight-year-old Rita Ascione is last surviving resident to recall life at tenement building at 97 Orchard Street, where she lived as a child in 1930s; building was condemned and its residents evicted in 1935; Lower East Side Tenement Museum, which bought building in 1980s, invited Ascione to revisit spot.
lead_paragraph: The Tenement Museum on the Lower East receives a visit from the last living resident who remembers the building as it was in the 1930s.

headline.seo: Lower East Side Tenement Museum Welcomes a Former Resident
headline.main: An Artifact Once Was Just Home
headline.print_headline: An Artifact Once Was Just Home
